definition: dialect/language/spoken words/speech/talk/words/conversation/what sb said/CL:種|种[zhong3],席[xi2],句[ju4],口[kou3],番[fan1]
to watch with amusement as sb makes a fool of himself
to make a fool of oneself
dirty jokes/jokes of a visceral nature

sentences.english: Your joke spared her needless embarrassment.
sentences.chinese: 你的笑话解除了她不必要的焦虑。

sentences.english: I’m just a naughty boy. I’m a joke-teller.
sentences.chinese: 我只是个顽皮的男孩，一个说笑话的人。

sentences.english: Collections of short jokes especially written for texters are best-sellers.
sentences.chinese: 那些专门为短信族编写的短篇笑话集也十分畅销。

sentences.english: We shared glances in class and laughed at each other's jokes.
sentences.chinese: 我们在教室相互凝视着，各自嘲笑对方所讲的笑话。

sentences.english: Juts a joke, don't get too serious.
sentences.chinese: 一篇在硅谷盛传的笑话，你以为你老板在想啥？

sentences.english: He is a running joke with most people.
sentences.chinese: 对大部分人来说，他不过是个甩不掉的笑话。

sentences.english: He often parenthesizes a talk with jokes.
sentences.chinese: 他常常在交谈中插入几句玩笑话。

sentences.english: I decided to treat his remark as jok .
sentences.chinese: 我把他的话当做玩笑话。

sentences.english: AMUSE】The storyteller's jokes amused the children.
sentences.chinese: 说书人的笑话逗乐了孩子。

sentences.english: You call Chinggis khan as a barbarian, what a joke.
sentences.chinese: 你们说成吉思汗是个野蛮人，这是个笑话。

sentences.english: Most make you giggle and groan in equal measure.
sentences.chinese: 书中大部分笑话令人笑过之后掩卷叹息。

sentences.english: He tried to break through the cloud of gloom hanging over his roomates with a joke.
sentences.chinese: 他试图讲句笑话打破笼罩着同室朋友间的郁闷气氛。

sentences.english: You Pakis have also become a poor joke.
sentences.chinese: 你们巴基斯坦人也是个可怜的笑话。

sentences.english: Go 'long home and get laughed at.
sentences.chinese: 滚回去吧，让人家看你的笑话去吧。

sentences.english: People would have laughed at me… a cellar rat selling real estate.
sentences.chinese: 大伙儿会笑话我的，一只住地下室的耗子卖房地产。

definition: to watch with amusement as sb makes a fool of himself
a matter for ridicule/an object of ridicule/laughingstock
to play a joke/to make fun of/to joke
item of storytelling or performed dialogue (folk arts)/sketch
comedic material/(in reference to a person) laughingstock/butt of jokes
to make a fool of oneself
